fields.name: Easy
fields.description: This should be easy to decipher. It was encrypted using a shift cipher of one to the right.

fields.name: A Bit Harder
fields.description: For a little bit more of a challenge, this was encrypted using a shift cipher of two to the left.

fields.name: Halfway There
fields.description: Rot-13 shift ciphers are interesting because the same cipher is used for encrypting and decrypting.

fields.name: Switching Things Up
fields.description: For this challenge, you are given a message and need to encrypt it using a shift cipher of 4 to the right.

fields.name: Hello, Caesar
fields.description: Julius Caesar used a shift cipher of -3 (three to the left) to encrypt messages.

fields.name: A Real Sentence
fields.description: The number of words in the message is the same as the amount of shift used to encrypt it. Of course, once you've decrypted one, you've decrypted them all.
fields.problem: JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW
fields.solution: BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO

fields.name: A Prime Challenge
fields.description: This message was encrypted using a shift cipher. The characters were shifted by the product of the first two positive prime numbers.

fields.name: A Sour Note
fields.description: The keyword "LEMON" was used to encrypt this message using a Vigenère cipher.
fields.problem: ELQ ARPXUBT TW UB GSI BOEV
fields.solution: THE MEETING IS IN THE PARK

fields.name: Quickly Now
fields.description: Your partner's identify has been discovered and you need to let her know. Encrypt the following message using a Vigenère cipher and the keyword "FAST"
fields.problem: YOU HAVE TO GET OUT NOW
fields.solution: DOM AFVW MT GWM TUL GTW
